toolType.description: Type of tool. This defines the layout to be used. SLICE_SELECTOR_TOOL refers to a tool where a slice is selected. SEGMENTATION_TOOL refers to a tool where a segmentation is created. CONFIRMATION_TOOL refers to a tool to confirm results, the output is only true/false without need for binding to anything.
toolType.$comment: It is deprecated property. There is no much use of it due to the fact that tool configuration is now flexible and allows to have both segmentation and annotation widgets in a single configuration.

possibleValueInAnnotationTable.description: A possible value of an annotation.

valueToDisplay.description: Value in to be displayed to the user.

defaultAnnotationTableOption.description: A default option of an annotation table

title.description: Title of the option. It can be displayed if required but cannot be modified. This can also be seen as the column name in an annotation table

ontologyId.description: Id of the ontology where the value of the annotation is retrieved.

ontologyConcept.description: Concept of the annotation in the ontology.

valueToDisplay.description: Value in to be displayed to the user.

annotationTableOption.description: One option of an annotation table

title.description: Title of the option to be display. This can also be seen as the column name in an annotation table

ontologyId.description: Id of the ontology where the value of the annotation is retrieved.

hasDefaultValue.description: If the annotation has a default value.

defaultValue.description: This is the default value of the annotation.

inputsAnnotationTool.description: Inputs for the annotation tool. The spineInputOuput schema is extended to have a property required.

required.description: True if the input is required.

outputsAnnotationTool.description: Outputs for the annotation tool. The spineInputOuput schema used.

viewersTool.description: Configuration of all the viewers for the tool.

layout.description: Layout to be used for the viewers

type.description: Layout to be used for the viewers

layoutOrder.description: Assignation of viewer in the layout based on the order defined by the layout. The match is done by associating a key-name in the layout to the key-name of a viewer in the tool

.*.description: String corresponding to the viewer key-name of a viewer in the tool

renderWindows.description: Configuration of the viewers in the tool

scenesConfiguration.description: Configuration of scene elements like original image, overlays (rois).

primaryImageInputKey.description: The reference key to input image being used as reference image. All other images (eg. MRI, segmentations, attention maps) will use the space of original image. If overlays are of different size, they will be resampled and cut according to primary Image space (bounding box and origin).

rois.description: The object defining all scene elements (rois) to be visualized.

overlays.description: The array of reference keys that needs to be visualized in scene. The order is important - following layers can cover predecessors

masks.description: The array of reference keys that needs to be visualized in scene. The order is important - following layers can cover predecessors

geometricalROIs.description: The array of reference keys that needs to be visualized in scene. The order is important - following layers can cover predecessors

polydatas.description: The array of reference keys that needs to be visualized in scene. The order is important - following layers can cover predecessors

fromInputs.description: Shall lookup table configuration be taken from file. If so, proper input should be created.

lutInputKey.description: The key of input providing lookup table configuration (value).

type.description: The type of LUT when not provided by input.
type.$comment: TODO: Establish whether still in use

fromInputs.description: Shall lookup table description configuration be taken from file. If so, proper input should be created.

lutDescriptionInputKey.description: The key of input providing lookup table configuration (value).

type.description: The type of LUT description when not provided by input.
type.$comment: TODO: Establish whether still in use

overlayConfiguration.description: Configuration of overlay (labelmap, segmentation) to be visualized in the tool.

fromInputs.description: Shall overlay configuration be taken from file. If so, proper input should be created.

lutKey.description: The reference key of lookup table that needs to be used to visualize label values with proper colors. Refers to lookup table configuration section.

lutDescriptionKey.description: The reference key of lookup table description that needs to be used to provide legend for overlay. Refers to lookup table descriptions configuration section.

label.description: The label for an overlay to be displayed in legend (eg. 'Contribution of John Doe', 'Segmentation of Medulla Oblongata', etc.).

imageInputKey.description: The optional reference key to the input providing overlay data (if 'fromInputs' is set to be true)

onInit.description: The set of predefined conditions determining initial state of overlay

visible.description: Shall overlay be visible when tool is initialized

scalarTypeValueConfiguration.description: Configuration of type and value properties for scalar

vectorTypeValueConfiguration.description: Configuration of type and value properties for vector

roiAnnotationLinks.description: List of roi annotation table ids that can be linked to the pointed roi. The id must refer to one of the annotation tables listed in the rois section

nameRoi.description: Corresponds to the name of the roi to be used in the widget. The roi name must be part of the rois object.

relationWithRoi.description: The point can be inside the roi or can be a explicit ROI, e.g., AC/PC points

implicitRelationWithRoi.description: In case that the relationWithRoi is an implicit relationship the implicit relationship type has to be defined here.

roisAnnotationTable.description: Annotation tables for the rois. For instance if the tool is used to annotation lesions and peri-ventricular spaces.

map_InputROI_OuputAnnotation.description: Mapping of ROI in the inputs and the annotations added by the tool.

roiInputName.description: Name of the input having the ROIs

annotationInputName.description: Name of the input having the annotations

bindingToolInputToViewerInput.description: Mapping a tool input to a viewer input

inputTool.description: Key-name of the input to be connected to an input of a viewer

inputViewer.description: Object defining the input for a viewer

property.description: Property of the viewer to be connected to the input of the tool

bindingViewerOutputToToolOutput.description: Mapping a viewer output to a tool output

outputTool.description: Key-name of the tool output to be connected to an output of a viewer

outputViewer.description: Object defining the output for a viewer

property.description: Property of the viewer to be connected to the output of the tool

name.description: The name of the annotation tool. For instance, annotation tool with three viewers only axial planes.

type.description: This defines the type of tool. This is mostly used in the front-end to define what the tool outputs.

annotationTables.description: Configuration of the ROIs for the annotation tool.

outputs.description: Object with the outputs of the tool

bindingToolInputsToViewerInputs.description: Binding of tool inputs to the viewer inputs

bindingViewerOutputsToViewesOutputs.description: Binding of viewer's inputs to tool outputs

configuration.description: Configuration of the particular tool. For instance the particular configuration of an anotation tool.

lutDescriptions.description: Map of lookup table descriptions configurations

rois.description: Configuration of the regions of interests. Contains maps of different scene objects, like overlays, masks and geometrical ROIs

overlays.description: Map of overlays (labelmaps, segmentations) used in a tool.

masks.description: Map of overlays (labelmaps, segmentations) being used as masks in a tool.

interactions.description: The definition of interactions between mask and other elements of tool. This is property that really distinguishes mask from overlay

PREVENT_FROM_ADDING_PIN.description: The interaction between mask and anotation tool preventing from adding pin in a voxel belonging to mask

PREVENT_FROM_CHANGING_VOXEL_VALUE.description: The interaction between mask and painting tools preventing from changing a value of voxel being at the same location as voxel belonging to mask

geometricalROIs.description: Map of geometrical (implicit) ROIs to be used in tool. TODO: To be finished -  it is only a placeholder.

polydatas.description: Map of polydata ROIs to be used in a tool.

fromInputs.description: Shall polydata be taken from file. If so, proper input should be created.

dataInputKey.description: The reference key to input providing polydata.

scenes.description: Configuration of the scenes to be displayed in viewers.

annotationScenes.description: Map of data bindings between ROIs and annotations with respect to scenes. TODO: To be finished -  it is only a placeholder.

viewers.description: Configuration of the viewers for the tool.

widgets.description: Configuration of the widgets for the tool.

tool_API_GET.description: Schema for reponse when using GET

creationDate.description: Creation date of the annotation tool.

toolCreateAndAnnotateROI.description: Description of a tool that creates and annotates ROIs.

annotationTables.description: Configuration of the ROIs for the annotation tool.

exposedAnnotationConcepts.description: All the exposed annotations concepts for a given ROI in the output

toolAddAnnotation.description: Description of a tool that adds annotations to ROIs.

annotationTables.description: Configuration of the ROIs for the annotation tool.

map_InputROIs_OuputAnnotations.description: Mapping of the annotations that will added to each ROI in the input.

toolCreateROI.description: Description of a tool that creates ROIs.
